project.name: C-C833A-GREP-01-ST01-DT02-DF11-CF20-01
project.description: Creating test case using base program. Added an environment variable read to the function definition. Completed injection.

iopair.name: C-C833A-GREP-01-ST01-DT02-DF11-CF20-01-GOOD-01
iopair.description: all words beginning with e or x, case sensitive This weakness expects a string in the form: '<qsize> <data>' where qsize is the size of the quick sort (used to delay execution), and data is a string containing no spaces. If the data string contains underscores, spawn two threads - one to replace the underscores with hyphens, and one to capitalize it. The two threads get two separate locks, but they try to obtain them in reverse order. If the qsort is large enough, these attempts to get the locks will interleave, resulting in deadlock. In order to hit the weakness, qsize >= 5000000, and the data string must have underscores in it.

process.script: if [[ -f "/opt/stonesoup/workspace/inputDaemons/preprocess_daemon_script_01.pid" ]]; then killtree.sh -s 9 -p $(cat "/opt/stonesoup/workspace/inputDaemons/preprocess_daemon_script_01.pid") && echo "Killed script."; else echo "Failed: Script PID file does not exist."; fi

scoring_formula.formula: STDOUT-01 AND NOT TIMEOUT AND NOT CONTROLLED_EXIT

output_checks.simple_check: if (( $(/bin/grep "toCap: Releasing lock 1" "logfile.txt" | wc -l) > 0 )); then true; else false; fi;
if (( $(/bin/grep "toCap: Releasing lock 0" "logfile.txt" | wc -l) > 0 )); then true; else false; fi;
if (( $(/bin/grep "replace: Releasing lock 1" "logfile.txt" | wc -l) > 0 )); then true; else false; fi;
if (( $(/bin/grep "replace: Releasing lock 0" "logfile.txt" | wc -l) > 0 )); then true; else false; fi;
